comments.author: shasan
comments.body: Quote from: hedgeprx on October 29, 2023, 05:04:32 AMLOAN AMOUNT: 0.031 BTC/ $1650REASON: PERSONALREPAYMENT: 18LTC OR BTC EQUIVALENTREPAYMENT DATE: 08/11/23COLLAT: 1150 USDT Usdt in which network? Erc20 or trc20?

comments.author: Eternad
comments.body: Quote from: hedgeprx on October 29, 2023, 05:04:32 AMLOAN AMOUNT: 0.031 BTC/ $1650REASON: PERSONALREPAYMENT: 18LTC OR BTC EQUIVALENTREPAYMENT DATE: 08/11/23COLLAT: 1150 USDT Your collateral is much lower than the amount you are borrowing. Even bank will never allow this kind of collateral which they are in loss already the moment they approve your loan.You should request loan amount much lower than your collateral if you are really serious on asking for loan. This is an instant profit for you when someone fill your loan since you have nothing to lose with your newbie account.

comments.author: Timelord2067
comments.body: So you waited four months after creating your *cough* "new" (sly wink) UID to then in your first post ask for a loan? (Looks to be just enough to cover another loan with a little left over)

comments.author: HedgeFx
comments.body: I bet my As* that this user is probably trying to exploit my name to carry out some scams. Better if someone red tags him as soon as possible

comments.author: hopenotlate
comments.body: I think it's a troll account, like almost all the newbies popping up in this section, request is unclear :  0.031 BTC are worth around 1065 $ but they ask alternatively for 0.031 or 1650 USDT ( that doesn't make much sense imo); also repayment 18 LTC or BTC equivalent should be more clear : BTC equivalent at the time of loan or repayment one?Let see if they are serious with their loan request or will never post again here

Even bank will never allow this kind of collateral which they are in loss already the moment they approve your loan.You should request loan amount much lower than your collateral if you are really serious on asking for loan. This is an instant profit for you when someone fill your loan since you have nothing to lose with your newbie account.there may be slight confusion as the post is not well written, i am asking for 0.031 btc which stands at $1668 AUD at the time of this post, offering collateral of 1150 usdt which currently sits at $1807 AUD, sorry for the confusion on this post.Quote from: HedgeFx on October 29, 2023, 11:26:14 AMI bet my As* that this user is probably trying to exploit my name to carry out some scams. Better if someone red tags him as soon as possible In no way am i trying to replicate or mimic you, in fact as of the time of this original post this has been my first time back on this forum in a couple of months.I own a private hedge fund alongside a friend hence why i decided upon hedge, and prx was just a random addition to the end of my name.THANKS.

comments.author: condoras
comments.body: Quote from: hedgeprx on October 30, 2023, 07:35:12 AMQuote from: Eternad on October 29, 2023, 05:46:31 AMQuote from: hedgeprx on October 29, 2023, 05:04:32 AMLOAN AMOUNT: 0.031 BTC/ $1650REASON: PERSONALREPAYMENT: 18LTC OR BTC EQUIVALENTREPAYMENT DATE: 08/11/23COLLAT: 1150 USDT Your collateral is much lower than the amount you are borrowing. Even bank will never allow this kind of collateral which they are in loss already the moment they approve your loan.You should request loan amount much lower than your collateral if you are really serious on asking for loan. This is an instant profit for you when someone fill your loan since you have nothing to lose with your newbie account.there may be slight confusion as the post is not well written, i am asking for 0.031 btc which stands at $1668 AUD at the time of this post, offering collateral of 1150 usdt which currently sits at $1807 AUD, sorry for the confusion on this post.Even if you make this mistake, the collateral remains in low % compared with the loan amount that you ask. You want BTC, so your collateral must be at least 120% higher based on the BTC that you want and not based on their value or the fiat currency that you will sell/ trade the BTC. There is a difference...

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Quote from: hedgeprx on October 29, 2023, 05:04:32 AMLOAN AMOUNT: 0.031 BTC/ $1650REASON: PERSONALREPAYMENT: 0.035 BTCREPAYMENT DATE: 08/11/23COLLAT: 1150 USDT Something I don't understand hereWhy not just sell the collateral you have, for the BTC you need? I mean, it's just USDT. It isn't going to change any value that much. If it was the other way round, it would make some sense, since some people don't like selling off their BTC with the feeling that the price might go up after a while.

comments.author: HedgeFx
comments.body: When you will accept that you lose? Why you continue to wrote shi* about me?Edit: I think that behind this troll called “hedgeprx” there is Timelord. Quote from: Timelord2067 on October 31, 2023, 05:45:19 AMQuote from: Bitcoin_Arena on October 30, 2023, 11:47:10 PMSomething I don't understand hereThe USDT is probably from the loan he owes on and is trying to payout with this loan.

comments.author: hopenotlate
comments.body: Quote from: Timelord2067 on October 31, 2023, 05:45:19 AMQuote from: Bitcoin_Arena on October 30, 2023, 11:47:10 PMSomething I don't understand hereThe USDT is probably from the loan he owes on and is trying to payout with this loan.Again a baseless hypothesis : he currently owes me the loan, we are in constant communication and I would have no problem giving him an extension if he asked me and he knows that.Being that said let's think together for a moment with a cool head : do you really think ,knowing he would be granted an extension by just asking, he would chose the alternative way of using an account he created four months in advance using basically pretty much the same username except for 2 consonants and writing a poorly structured loan request ?Not to mention that this loan request mentions AUD while HedgeFx is from an European country, then mention BTC , LTC , USDT without explaining which blockhain.Basically nothing matches beside the username.I used to watch at you in the past as an asset for this forum but lately your judgment seems clouded by your feelings.

comments.author: Timelord2067
comments.body: Quote from: HedgeFx on October 31, 2023, 07:19:17 AMEdit: I think that behind this troll called “hedgeprx” there is Timelord. Getting desperate with your defense of your ban evasion wouldn't you agree?Quote from: hopenotlate on October 31, 2023, 10:46:27 AMAgain a baseless hypothesis : he currently owes me the loan, He's late again and you see nothing wrong with that?QuoteNot to mention that this loan request mentions AUD Yeh - real spooky that (given it's Halloween    ).You're the one that is owed money, yet you lash out at the wrong person.

comments.author: hopenotlate
comments.body: Quote from: hopenotlate on October 31, 2023, 10:46:27 AMHe's late again and you see nothing wrong with that?This is a false statement: if you check here https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5469148.0 you can see by yourself the established deadline was October 31 that he respected; dunno if you said he didn't because of different timezones ( don't know where you live), but he respected agreed deadline in my ( and his) timezone by 8 hours or so. Also he respected all the deadlines of all the loans I gave him ( that I invite you to doublecheck), that are at least 5 or 6. Moreover, several times he repaid me in advance.Quote from: hopenotlate on October 31, 2023, 10:46:27 AMYou're the one that is owed money, yet you lash out at the wrong person.As I told above I received once again everything I was due; sorry if I gave the impression of attacking you, not being a native english I may misuse words. What I meant to say is that over the years the way I see you has changed. Maybe I've changed or maybe you've changed or more likely both, no hard feelings.That's all.
